rows.arabic: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ
rows.translation: In the Name of Allah, the All-beneficent, the All-merciful.
rows.transliteration: bismillāhir raḥmānir raḥīm

rows.arabic: وَٱلذَّٰرِيَـٰتِ ذَرْوًا
rows.translation: By the scattering [winds] that scatter [the clouds];
rows.transliteration: wadh dhāriyāti dharwā

rows.arabic: فَٱلْحَـٰمِلَـٰتِ وِقْرًا
rows.translation: by the [rain] bearing [clouds] laden [with water];
rows.transliteration: fal ḥāmilāti wiqrā

rows.arabic: فَٱلْجَـٰرِيَـٰتِ يُسْرًا
rows.translation: by [the ships] which move gently [on the sea];
rows.transliteration: fal jāriyāti yusrā

rows.arabic: فَٱلْمُقَسِّمَـٰتِ أَمْرًا
rows.translation: by [the angels] who dispense [livelihood] by [His] command:
rows.transliteration: fal muqassimāti amrā

rows.arabic: إِنَّمَا تُوعَدُونَ لَصَادِقٌ
rows.translation: indeed what you are promised is true,
rows.transliteration: innamā tū`adūna laṣādiq

rows.arabic: وَإِنَّ ٱلدِّينَ لَوَٰقِعٌ
rows.translation: and indeed the retribution will surely come to pass!
rows.transliteration: wa innad dīna lawāqi`

rows.arabic: وَٱلسَّمَآءِ ذَاتِ ٱلْحُبُكِ
rows.translation: By the sky full of adornment [with stars],
rows.transliteration: was samā-i dhātil ḥubuk

rows.arabic: إِنَّكُمْ لَفِى قَوْلٍ مُّخْتَلِفٍ
rows.translation: indeed you are of different opinions!
rows.transliteration: innakum lafī qawlin mukhtalif

rows.arabic: يُؤْفَكُ عَنْهُ مَنْ أُفِكَ
rows.translation: He who has been turned away [from the truth] is turned away from it.
rows.transliteration: yu-faku `anhu man ufik

rows.arabic: قُتِلَ ٱلْخَرَّٰصُونَ
rows.translation: Perish the liars,
rows.transliteration: qutilal-kharrāṣūn

rows.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ فِى غَمْرَةٍ سَاهُونَ
rows.translation: who are heedless in a stupor!
rows.transliteration: alladhīna hum fī ghamratin sāhūn

rows.arabic: يَسْـَٔلُونَ أَيَّانَ يَوْمُ ٱلدِّينِ
rows.translation: They ask, ‘When will be the Day of Retribution?’
rows.transliteration: yas-alūna ayyāna yawmud dīn

rows.arabic: يَوْمَ هُمْ عَلَى ٱلنَّارِ يُفْتَنُونَ
rows.translation: It is the day when they will be tormented in the Fire,
rows.transliteration: yawma hum `alan nāri yuftanūn

rows.arabic: ذُوقُوا۟ فِتْنَتَكُمْ هَـٰذَا ٱلَّذِى كُنتُم بِهِۦ تَسْتَعْجِلُونَ
rows.translation: [and will be told]: ‘Taste your torment. This is what you used to hasten.’
rows.transliteration: dhūqū fitnatakum hādhal ladhī kuntum bihi tasta`jilūn

rows.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ فِى جَنَّـٰتٍ وَعُيُونٍ
rows.translation: Indeed the Godwary will be amid gardens and springs,
rows.transliteration: innal muttaqīna fī jannātin wa`uyūn

rows.arabic: ءَاخِذِينَ مَآ ءَاتَىٰهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ قَبْلَ ذَٰلِكَ مُحْسِنِينَ
rows.translation: receiving what their Lord has given them, for they had been virtuous aforetime.
rows.transliteration: ākhidhīna mā ātāhum rabbuhum ۚ innahum kānū qabla dhālika muḥsinīn

rows.arabic: كَانُوا۟ قَلِيلًا مِّنَ ٱلَّيْلِ مَا يَهْجَعُونَ
rows.translation: They used to sleep a little during the night,
rows.transliteration: kānū qalīlan minal layli mā yahja`ūn

rows.arabic: وَبِٱلْأَسْحَارِ هُمْ يَسْتَغْفِرُونَ
rows.translation: and at dawns they would plead for forgiveness,
rows.transliteration: wabil-as-ḥāri hum yastaghfirūn

rows.arabic: وَفِىٓ أَمْوَٰلِهِمْ حَقٌّ لِّلسَّآئِلِ وَٱلْمَحْرُومِ
rows.translation: and there was a share in their wealth for the beggar and the deprived.
rows.transliteration: wafī amwālihim ḥaqqul lissā-ili wal maḥrūm

rows.arabic: وَفِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ءَايَـٰتٌ لِّلْمُوقِنِينَ
rows.translation: In the earth are signs for those who have conviction,
rows.transliteration: wafil-arḍi āyātul lil-mūqinīn

rows.arabic: وَفِىٓ أَنفُسِكُمْ ۚ أَفَلَا تُبْصِرُونَ
rows.translation: and in your souls [as well]. Will you not then perceive?
rows.transliteration: wafī anfusikum ۚ afalā tubṣirūn

rows.arabic: وَفِى ٱلسَّمَآءِ رِزْقُكُمْ وَمَا تُوعَدُونَ
rows.translation: And in the sky is your provision and what you are promised.
rows.transliteration: wafis samā-i rizqukum wa mā tū`adūn

rows.arabic: فَوَرَبِّ ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ إِنَّهُۥ لَحَقٌّ مِّثْلَ مَآ أَنَّكُمْ تَنطِقُونَ
rows.translation: By the Lord of the sky and the earth, it is indeed the truth, just as [it is a fact that] you speak.
rows.transliteration: fawarabbis samā-i wal-arḍi innahu laḥaqqun mithla mā annakum tanṭiqūn

rows.arabic: هَلْ أَتَىٰكَ حَدِيثُ ضَيْفِ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ ٱلْمُكْرَمِينَ
rows.translation: Did you receive the story of Abraham’s honoured guests?
rows.transliteration: hal atāka ḥadīthu ḍayfi ibrāhīmal mukramīn

rows.arabic: إِذْ دَخَلُوا۟ عَلَيْهِ فَقَالُوا۟ سَلَـٰمًا ۖ قَالَ سَلَـٰمٌ قَوْمٌ مُّنكَرُونَ
rows.translation: When they entered into his presence, they said, ‘Peace!’ ‘Peace!’ He answered, ‘[You are] an unfamiliar folk.’
rows.transliteration: idh dakhalū `alayhi faqālū salāmā ۖ qāla salāmun qawmun munkarūn

rows.arabic: فَرَاغَ إِلَىٰٓ أَهْلِهِۦ فَجَآءَ بِعِجْلٍ سَمِينٍ
rows.translation: Then he retired to his family and brought a fat [roasted] calf,
rows.transliteration: farāgha ilā ahlihi fajā-a bi`ijlin samīn

rows.arabic: فَقَرَّبَهُۥٓ إِلَيْهِمْ قَالَ أَلَا تَأْكُلُونَ
rows.translation: and put it near them. He said, ‘Will you not eat?’
rows.transliteration: faqarrabahu ilayhim qāla alā ta-kulūn

rows.arabic: فَأَوْجَسَ مِنْهُمْ خِيفَةً ۖ قَالُوا۟ لَا تَخَفْ ۖ وَبَشَّرُوهُ بِغُلَـٰمٍ عَلِيمٍ
rows.translation: Then he felt a fear of them. They said, ‘Do not be afraid!’ and they gave him the good news of a wise son.
rows.transliteration: fa-awjasa minhum khīfah ۖ qālū lā takhaf ۖ wabashharūhu bighulāmin `alīm

rows.arabic: فَأَقْبَلَتِ ٱمْرَأَتُهُۥ فِى صَرَّةٍ فَصَكَّتْ وَجْهَهَا وَقَالَتْ عَجُوزٌ عَقِيمٌ
rows.translation: Then his wife came forward crying [with joy]. She beat her face, and said, ‘A barren old woman!’
rows.transliteration: fa-aqbalatim-ra-atuhu fī ṣarratin faṣakkat wajhahā waqālat `ajūzun `aqīm

rows.arabic: قَالُوا۟ كَذَٰلِكِ قَالَ رَبُّكِ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلْحَكِيمُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ
rows.translation: They said, ‘So has your Lord said. Indeed He is the All-wise, the All-knowing.’
rows.transliteration: qālū kadhāliki qāla rabbuk ۖ innahu huwal ḥakīmul `alīm

rows.arabic: قَالَ فَمَا خَطْبُكُمْ أَيُّهَا ٱلْمُرْسَلُونَ
rows.translation: He said, ‘O messengers, what is now your errand?’
rows.transliteration: qāla famā khaṭbukum ayyuhal mursalūn

rows.arabic: قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّآ أُرْسِلْنَآ إِلَىٰ قَوْمٍ مُّجْرِمِينَ
rows.translation: They said, ‘We have been sent toward a guilty people,
rows.transliteration: qālū innā ursilnā ilā qawmin mujrimīn

rows.arabic: لِنُرْسِلَ عَلَيْهِمْ حِجَارَةً مِّن طِينٍ
rows.translation: that We may rain upon them stones of clay,
rows.transliteration: linursila `alayhim ḥijāratan min ṭīn

rows.arabic: مُّسَوَّمَةً عِندَ رَبِّكَ لِلْمُسْرِفِينَ
rows.translation: sent for the transgressors from your Lord.
rows.transliteration: musawwamatan `inda rabbika lil-musrifīn

rows.arabic: فَأَخْرَجْنَا مَن كَانَ فِيهَا مِنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: So We picked out those who were in it of the faithful,
rows.transliteration: fa-akhrajnā man kāna fīhā minal mu-minīn

rows.arabic: فَمَا وَجَدْنَا فِيهَا غَيْرَ بَيْتٍ مِّنَ ٱلْمُسْلِمِينَ
rows.translation: but We did not find there other than one house of Muslims,
rows.transliteration: famā wajadnā fīhā ghayra baytin minal muslimīn

rows.arabic: وَتَرَكْنَا فِيهَآ ءَايَةً لِّلَّذِينَ يَخَافُونَ ٱلْعَذَابَ ٱلْأَلِيمَ
rows.translation: and We have left therein a sign for those who fear a painful punishment.’
rows.transliteration: wataraknā fīhā āyatan lilladhīna yakhāfūnal `adhābal-alīm

rows.arabic: وَفِى مُوسَىٰٓ إِذْ أَرْسَلْنَـٰهُ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ بِسُلْطَـٰنٍ مُّبِينٍ
rows.translation: And in Moses [too there is a sign] when We sent him to Pharaoh with a manifest authority.
rows.transliteration: wafī mūsā idh arsalnāhu ilā fir`awna bisulṭānin mubīn

rows.arabic: فَتَوَلَّىٰ بِرُكْنِهِۦ وَقَالَ سَـٰحِرٌ أَوْ مَجْنُونٌ
rows.translation: But he turned away assured of his might, and said, ‘A magician or a crazy man!’
rows.transliteration: fatawallā biruknihi waqāla sāḥirun aw majnūn

rows.arabic: فَأَخَذْنَـٰهُ وَجُنُودَهُۥ فَنَبَذْنَـٰهُمْ فِى ٱلْيَمِّ وَهُوَ مُلِيمٌ
rows.translation: So We seized him and his hosts, and cast them into the sea, while he was blameworthy.
rows.transliteration: fa-akhadhnāhu wajunūdahu fanabadhnāhum fil yammi wahuwa mulīm

rows.arabic: وَفِى عَادٍ إِذْ أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلرِّيحَ ٱلْعَقِيمَ
rows.translation: And in ‘Ad when We unleashed upon them a barren wind.
rows.transliteration: wafī `ādin idh arsalnā `alayhimur rīḥal `aqīm

rows.arabic: مَا تَذَرُ مِن شَىْءٍ أَتَتْ عَلَيْهِ إِلَّا جَعَلَتْهُ كَٱلرَّمِيمِ
rows.translation: It left nothing that it came upon without making it like decayed bones.
rows.transliteration: mā tadharu min shay-in atat `alayhi illā ja`alat-hu kar ramīm

rows.arabic: وَفِى ثَمُودَ إِذْ قِيلَ لَهُمْ تَمَتَّعُوا۟ حَتَّىٰ حِينٍ
rows.translation: And in Thamud, when they were told, ‘Enjoy for a while.’
rows.transliteration: wafī thamūda idh qīla lahum tamatta`ū ḥattā ḥīn

rows.arabic: فَعَتَوْا۟ عَنْ أَمْرِ رَبِّهِمْ فَأَخَذَتْهُمُ ٱلصَّـٰعِقَةُ وَهُمْ يَنظُرُونَ
rows.translation: Then they defied the command of their Lord; so the thunderbolt seized them as they looked on.
rows.transliteration: fa`ataw `an amri rabbihim fa-akhadhat-humuṣ ṣā`iqatu wahum yanẓurūn

rows.arabic: فَمَا ٱسْتَطَـٰعُوا۟ مِن قِيَامٍ وَمَا كَانُوا۟ مُنتَصِرِينَ
rows.translation: So they were neither able to rise up, nor to come to one another’s aid.
rows.transliteration: famas-taṭā`ū min qiyāmin wa mā kānū muntaṣirīn

rows.arabic: وَقَوْمَ نُوحٍ مِّن قَبْلُ ۖ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ قَوْمًا فَـٰسِقِينَ
rows.translation: And the people of Noah aforetime. Indeed, they were a transgressing lot.
rows.transliteration: waqawma nūḥin min qabl ۖ innahum kānū qawman fāsiqīn

rows.arabic: وَٱلسَّمَآءَ بَنَيْنَـٰهَا بِأَيْي۟دٍ وَإِنَّا لَمُوسِعُونَ
rows.translation: We have built the heaven with might, and indeed it is We who are its expanders.
rows.transliteration: was samā-a banaynāhā bi-aydin wa innā lamūsi`ūn

rows.arabic: وَٱلْأَرْضَ فَرَشْنَـٰهَا فَنِعْمَ ٱلْمَـٰهِدُونَ
rows.translation: And We have spread out the earth, so how excellent spreaders We have been!
rows.transliteration: wal-arḍa farashnāhā fani`mal māhidūn

rows.arabic: وَمِن كُلِّ شَىْءٍ خَلَقْنَا زَوْجَيْنِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَذَكَّرُونَ
rows.translation: In all things We have created pairs so that you may take admonition.
rows.transliteration: wa min kulli shay-in khalaqnā zawjayni la`allakum tadhakkarūn

rows.arabic: فَفِرُّوٓا۟ إِلَى ٱللَّهِ ۖ إِنِّى لَكُم مِّنْهُ نَذِيرٌ مُّبِينٌ
rows.translation: ‘So flee toward Allah. Indeed, I am from Him a manifest warner to you.
rows.transliteration: fafirrū ilallāh ۖ innī lakum minhu nadhīrun mubīn

rows.arabic: وَلَا تَجْعَلُوا۟ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَـٰهًا ءَاخَرَ ۖ إِنِّى لَكُم مِّنْهُ نَذِيرٌ مُّبِينٌ
rows.translation: Do not set up another god besides Allah. Indeed I am from Him a manifest warner to you.’
rows.transliteration: walā taj`alū ma`allāhi ilāhan ākhar ۖ innī lakum minhu nadhīrun mubīn

rows.arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ مَآ أَتَى ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِم مِّن رَّسُولٍ إِلَّا قَالُوا۟ سَاحِرٌ أَوْ مَجْنُونٌ
rows.translation: So it was that there did not come any apostle to those who were before them but they said, ‘A magician,’ or ‘A crazy man!’
rows.transliteration: kadhālika mā atal ladhīna min qablihim min rasūlin illā qālū sāḥirun aw majnūn

rows.arabic: أَتَوَاصَوْا۟ بِهِۦ ۚ بَلْ هُمْ قَوْمٌ طَاغُونَ
rows.translation: Did they enjoin this upon one another?! Rather, they were a rebellious lot.
rows.transliteration: atawāṣaw bih ۚ bal hum qawmun ṭāghūn

rows.arabic: فَتَوَلَّ عَنْهُمْ فَمَآ أَنتَ بِمَلُومٍ
rows.translation: So turn away from them, as you will not be blameworthy.
rows.transliteration: fatawalla `anhum famā anta bimalūm

rows.arabic: وَذَكِّرْ فَإِنَّ ٱلذِّكْرَىٰ تَنفَعُ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: And admonish, for admonition indeed benefits the faithful.
rows.transliteration: wadhakkir fa-innadh dhikrā tanfa`ul mu-minīn

rows.arabic: وَمَا خَلَقْتُ ٱلْجِنَّ وَٱلْإِنسَ إِلَّا لِيَعْبُدُونِ
rows.translation: I did not create the jinn and the humans except that they may worship Me.
rows.transliteration: wa mā khalaqtul jinna wal-insa illā liya`budūn

rows.arabic: مَآ أُرِيدُ مِنْهُم مِّن رِّزْقٍ وَمَآ أُرِيدُ أَن يُطْعِمُونِ
rows.translation: I desire no provision from them, nor do I desire that they should feed Me.
rows.transliteration: mā urīdu minhum min rizqin wa mā urīdu an yuṭ`imūn

rows.arabic: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ هُوَ ٱلرَّزَّاقُ ذُو ٱلْقُوَّةِ ٱلْمَتِينُ
rows.translation: Indeed it is Allah who is the All-provider, Powerful and All-strong.
rows.transliteration: innallāha huwar razzāqu dhul quwwatil matīn

rows.arabic: فَإِنَّ لِلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا۟ ذَنُوبًا مِّثْلَ ذَنُوبِ أَصْحَـٰبِهِمْ فَلَا يَسْتَعْجِلُونِ
rows.translation: Indeed the lot of those who do wrong [now] will be like the lot of their [earlier] counterparts. So let them not ask Me to hasten on [that fate].
rows.transliteration: fa-inna lilladhīna ẓalamū dhanūban mithla dhanūbi aṣ-ḥābihim falā yasta`jilūn

rows.arabic: فَوَيْلٌ لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ مِن يَوْمِهِمُ ٱلَّذِى يُوعَدُونَ
rows.translation: Woe to the faithless for the day they are promised!
rows.transliteration: fawaylul lilladhīna kafarū min yawmihimul ladhī yū`adūn
